     2â†’-- architecture.md Â§7 ë°ì´í„° ëª¨ë¸ ê¸°ë°˜
     3â†’
     4â†’-- ============================================================
     5â†’-- 1. conversations
     6â†’-- ============================================================
     7â†’create table conversations (
     8â†’  id          uuid primary key default gen_random_uuid(),
     9â†’  user_id     uuid not null references auth.users(id) on delete cascade,
    10â†’  title       text not null default '',
    11â†’  created_at  timestamptz not null default now(),
    12â†’  updated_at  timestamptz not null default now()
    13â†’);
    14â†’
    15â†’create index idx_conversations_user_id on conversations(user_id);
    16â†’
    17â†’-- ============================================================
    18â†’-- 2. messages
    19â†’-- ============================================================
    20â†’-- type: user | assistant | artifact | proposal | status
    21â†’create table messages (
    22â†’  id                uuid primary key default gen_random_uuid(),
    23â†’  conversation_id   uuid not null references conversations(id) on delete cascade,
    24â†’  type              text not null check (type in ('user', 'assistant', 'artifact', 'proposal', 'status')),
    25â†’  content           jsonb not null default '{}'::jsonb,
    26â†’  created_at        timestamptz not null default now()
    27â†’);
    28â†’
    29â†’create index idx_messages_conversation_id on messages(conversation_id);
    30â†’create index idx_messages_created_at on messages(conversation_id, created_at);
    31â†’
    32â†’-- ============================================================
    33â†’-- 3. artifacts
    34â†’-- ============================================================
    35â†’-- type: paper_card | paper_collection | analysis_report | researcher_profile | research_note
    36â†’-- status: creating | ready | updating | archived
    37â†’create table artifacts (
    38â†’  id                uuid primary key default gen_random_uuid(),
    39â†’  conversation_id   uuid not null references conversations(id) on delete cascade,
    40â†’  type              text not null check (type in ('paper_card', 'paper_collection', 'analysis_report', 'researcher_profile', 'research_note')),
    41â†’  status            text not null default 'creating' check (status in ('creating', 'ready', 'updating', 'archived')),
    42â†’  data              jsonb not null default '{}'::jsonb,
    43â†’  parent_id         uuid references artifacts(id) on delete set null,
    44â†’  "references"      text[] not null default '{}',
    45â†’  created_at        timestamptz not null default now(),
    46â†’  updated_at        timestamptz not null default now()
    47â†’);
    48â†’
    49â†’create index idx_artifacts_conversation_id on artifacts(conversation_id);
    50â†’create index idx_artifacts_parent_id on artifacts(parent_id);
    51â†’
    52â†’-- ============================================================
    53â†’-- 4. research_journeys (ê²½í—˜ ê¸°ì–µ)
    54â†’-- ============================================================
    55â†’create table research_journeys (
    56â†’  id                uuid primary key default gen_random_uuid(),
    57â†’  conversation_id   uuid not null unique references conversations(id) on delete cascade,
    58â†’  user_id           uuid not null references auth.users(id) on delete cascade,
    59â†’  memories          jsonb not null default '[]'::jsonb,
    60â†’  created_at        timestamptz not null default now()
    61â†’);
    62â†’
    63â†’create index idx_research_journeys_user_id on research_journeys(user_id);
    64â†’
    65â†’-- ============================================================
    66â†’-- 5. updated_at ìë™ ê°±ì‹  íŠ¸ë¦¬ê±°
    67â†’-- ============================================================
    68â†’create or replace function update_updated_at()
    69â†’returns trigger as $$
    70â†’begin
    71â†’  new.updated_at = now();
    72â†’  return new;
    73â†’end;
    74â†’$$ language plpgsql;
    75â†’
    76â†’create trigger trg_conversations_updated_at
    77â†’  before update on conversations
    78â†’  for each row execute function update_updated_at();
    79â†’
    80â†’create trigger trg_artifacts_updated_at
    81â†’  before update on artifacts
    82â†’  for each row execute function update_updated_at();
    83â†’
    84â†’-- ============================================================
    85â†’-- 6. RLS (Row Level Security)
    86â†’-- ============================================================
    87â†’alter table conversations enable row level security;
    88â†’alter table messages enable row level security;
    89â†’alter table artifacts enable row level security;
    90â†’alter table research_journeys enable row level security;
    91â†’
    92â†’-- conversations: ë³¸ì¸ ì†Œìœ ë§Œ ì ‘ê·¼

Perfect! Now I have all the information I need. Let me compile a comprehensive report on the Phase 2 implementation progress.

## Phase 2 (ëŒ€í™” ì½”ì–´) Implementation Progress Report

Based on my exploration of the `/Users/jaeyoungkang/corca/lighthouse/` repository, here's the current state of Phase 2 implementation:

---

### WHAT HAS BEEN COMPLETED

#### 1. **Design Documentation (100% Complete)**
- **SPEC.md** - Fully rewritten with the conversational research colleague paradigm
  - Conversation canvas structure defined
  - Proposal cards documented
  - Artifact types and lifecycle specified
  - Autonomy levels (L1-L5) clearly defined
  - Experience memory system defined
  
- **Architecture.md** - Comprehensive design document
  - 3-plane architecture (Product, Agent, Execution)
  - Message types defined (user, assistant, artifact, proposal, status)
  - Data models specified (Conversation, Message, Artifact, ResearchJourney)
  - Memory system (3-tier: short-term, mid-term, long-term)
  - SSE streaming protocol designed
  
- **Supporting Docs**
  - `state-management.md` - FSM and state isolation patterns
  - `observability.md` - Monitoring system design
  - `conventions.md` - Coding rules and protocols
  - `design-state-alignment.md` - Validation checklist

#### 2. **Domain Models (100% Complete)**
All TypeScript domain types are defined in `/app/domain/`:
- `message.ts` - UserMessage, AssistantMessage, ArtifactMessage, ProposalMessage, StatusMessage, Proposal with AutonomyLevel
- `artifact.ts` - PaperCardData, PaperCollectionData, AnalysisReportData, ResearcherProfileData, ResearchNoteData
- `conversation.ts` - Conversation interface with userId, title, timestamps
- `memory.ts` - Memory types (exploration, discovery, judgment, pivot) and ResearchJourney
- `agent.ts` - AgentExecutionStatus FSM states
- All types properly exported and documented with references to architecture.md

#### 3. **Database Schema (100% Complete)**
Supabase migrations with full Phase 2 schema (`/supabase/migrations/00001_init.sql`):
- âœ… `conversations` table with user_id, title, timestamps
- âœ… `messages` table with type (user|assistant|artifact|proposal|status) and jsonb content
- âœ… `artifacts` table with type, status (creating|ready|updating|archived), jsonb data, parent_id, references
- âœ… `research_journeys` table for experience memory with jsonb memories
- âœ… RLS policies for all tables (user-scoped access)
- âœ… Proper indexes on foreign keys and timestamps
- âœ… Auto-update triggers for updated_at fields

#### 4. **Server Infrastructure**
- âœ… Supabase client integration (`/app/lib/supabase/client.ts` and `server.ts`)

- Thursday (2/26): Another sharing
- Next Monday (3/2): Another sharing
- Next week: Recruit testers for private alpha test

And they noticed that their task management principle doesn't include scheduling.

This is a good observation. The task-management-principle.md has project tracking, status markers, topic switching, etc. 

I notice the principle focuses on organizational structure but doesn't account for time-based scheduling. I should update the projects file with these upcoming dates and then think through whether scheduling belongs as a core principle or just as practical metadata in the task system.
